text: I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul
author: Pablo Neruda

text: Only the very weak-minded refuse to be influenced by literature and poetry
author: Cassandra Clare

text: Music expresses that which cannot be put into words and that which cannot remain silent
author: Victor hugo

text: We love the things we love for what they are
author: Robert Frost

text: You talk when you cease to be at peace with your thoughts
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: Every heart sings a song, incomplete, until another heart whispers back. Those who wish to sing always find a song. At the touch of a lover, everyone becomes a poet
author: Plato

text: Tell me, what is it you plan to do with your one wild and precious life?
author: Mary Oliver

text: I have loved the stars too fondly to be fearful of the night
author: Sarah Williams

text: Painting is poetry that is seen rather than felt, and poetry is painting that is felt rather than seen
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: Resist much, obey little
author: Walt Whitman

text: Unbeing dead isn't being alive
author: E. E. Cummings

text: A poem begins as a lump in the throat, a sense of wrong, a homesickness, a lovesickness
author: Robert Frost

text: Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese
author: G.K. Chesterton

text: Trees are poems the earth writes upon the sky, We fell them down and turn them into paper, That we may record our emptiness
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: One ought, every day at least, to hear a little song, read a good poem, see a fine picture, and, if it were possible, to speak a few reasonable words
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead; I lift my eyes and all is born again
author: Sylvia Plath

text: What is that you express in your eyes? It seems to me more than all the print I have read in my life
author: Walt Whitman

text: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go
author: T.S. Eliot

text: Let our scars fall in love
author: Galway Kinnell

text: This is the way the world ends Not with a bang but a whimper
author: T.S. Eliot

text: Forgive, O Lord, my little jokes on Thee And I'll forgive Thy great big one on me
author: Robert Frost

text: If I had my life to live over again, I would have made a rule to read some poetry and listen to some music at least once every week
author: Charles Darwin

text: ...and then, I have nature and art and poetry, and if that is not enough, what is enough?
author: Vincent Willem van Gogh

text: Always be a poet, even in prose
author: Charles Baudelaire

text: If you have the words, there's always a chance that you'll find the way
author: Seamus Heaney

text: One should always be drunk. That's all that matters...But with what? With wine, with poetry, or with virtue, as you chose. But get drunk
author: Charles Baudelaire

text: Poetry is what gets lost in translation
author: Robert Frost

text: I like this place and could willingly waste my time in it
author: William Shakespeare

text: Poetry is what happens when nothing else can
author: Charles Bukowski

text: What a strange thing! to be alive beneath cherry blossoms
author: Kobayashi Issa

text: You might as well ask an artist to explain his art, or ask a poet to explain his poem. It defeats the purpose. The meaning is only clear thorough the search
author: Rick Riordan

text: I have drunken deep of joy, And I will taste no other wine tonight
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

text: There is not a particle of life which does not bear poetry within it
author: Gustave Flaubert

text: Poetry might be defined as the clear expression of mixed feelings
author: W.H. Auden

text: My turn shall also come: I sense the spreading of a wing
author: Osip Mandelstam

text: Lovers alone wear sunlight
author: E.E. Cummings

text: Break a vase, and the love that reassembles the fragments is stronger than that love which took its symmetry for granted when it was whole
author: Derek Walcott

text: Poetry heals the wounds inflicted by reason
author: Novalis

text: Once, poets were magicians. Poets were strong, stronger than warriors or kings — stronger than old hapless gods. And they will be strong once again
author: Greg Bear

text: Love consists of this: two solitudes that meet, protect and greet each other
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

text: I know you're tired but come, this is the way
author: Jalalu'l-din Rumi

text: Poetry is eternal graffiti written in the heart of everyone
author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti

text: Perhaps the truth depends on a walk around the lake
author: Wallace Stevens

text: Anon, who wrote so many poems without signing them, was often a woman
author: Virginia Woolf

text: Music is the universal language of mankin
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

text: Don't use the phone. People are never ready to answer it. Use poetry
author: Jack Kerouac

text: Poetry is the shadow cast by our streetlight imaginations
author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti

text: Those who are willing to be vulnerable move among mysteries
author: Theodore Roethke

text: Love, the poet said, is woman's whole existence
author: Virginia Woolf

text: All my heart is yours, sir: it belongs to you; and with you it would remain, were fate to exile the rest of me from your presence forever
author: Charlotte Bronte

text: You give but little when you give of your possessions. It is when you give of yourself that you truly give
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: Love is heavy and light, bright and dark, hot and cold, sick and healthy, asleep and awake- its everything except what it is!
author: William Shakespeare

text: Given the choice between the experience of pain and nothing, I would choose pain
author: William Faulkner

text: I don't care what you say to me. I care what you share with me
author: Santosh Kalwar

text: The purpose of life is to be defeated by greater and greater things
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

text: Closed in a room, my imagination becomes the universe, and the rest of the world is missing out
author: Criss Jami

text: I turned silences and nights into words. What was unutterable, I wrote down. I made the whirling world stand still
author: Arthur Rimbaud

text: I am no longer in love with her, that's certain, but maybe I love her. Love is so short, forgetting is so long
author: Pablo Neruda

text: The poetry of the earth is never dead
author: John Keats

text: The death of a beautiful woman is, unquestionably, the most poetical topic in the world
author: Edgar Allan Poe

text: Poetry is just so emo. he said. Oh, the pain. The pain. It always rains. In my soul
author: John Green

text: A good poem is a contribution to reality. The world is never the same once a good poem has been added to it. A good poem helps to change the shape of the universe, helps to extend everyone's knowledge of himself and the world around him
author: Dylan Thomas

text: If your daily life seems poor, do not blame it; blame yourself, tell yourself that you are not poet enough to call forth its riches; for to the creator there is no poverty and no poor indifferent place
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

text: To be a poet is a condition, not a profession
author: Robert Frost

text: Poetry is just the evidence of life. If your life is burning well, poetry is just the ash
author: Leonard Cohen

text: Love one another, but make not a bond of love: Let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls
author: Khalil Gibran

text: Genuine poetry can communicate before it is understood
author: T.S. Eliot

text: may came home with a smooth round stone as small as a world and as large as alone
author: E.E. Cummings

text: Peace is always beautiful
author: Walt Whitman

text: Into the darkness they go, the wise and the lovely
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

text: Poetry, she thought, wasn't written to be analyzed; it was meant to inspire without reason, to touch without understanding
author: Nicholas Sparks

text: We have calcium in our bones, iron in our veins, carbon in our souls, and nitrogen in our brains. 93 percent stardust, with souls made of flames, we are all just stars that have people names
author: Nikita Gill

text: It was at that age that poetry came in search of me
author: Pablo Neruda

text: With me poetry has not been a purpose, but a passion
author: Edgar Allan Poe

text: If I can see pain in your eyes then share with me your tears. If I can see joy in your eyes then share with me your smile
author: Santosh Kalwar

text: Always learn poems by heart. They have to become the marrow in your bones. Like fluoride in the water, they'll make your soul impervious to the world's soft decay
author: Janet Fitch

text: Beauty is eternity gazing at itself in a mirror. But you are eternity and you are the mirror
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: I lean to you, numb as a fossil. Tell me I'm here
author: Sylvia Plath

text: You will always be the bread and the knife, not to mention the crystal goblet and—somehow—the wine
author: Billy Collins

text: I discover myself on the verge of a usual mistake
author: Walt Whitman

text: i carry your heart with me(i carry it in my heart)
author: E.E. Cummings

text: It is strange how often a heart must be broken Before the years can make it wise
author: Sara Teasdale

text: My imagination makes me human and makes me a fool; it gives me all the world and exiles me from it
author: Ursula K. Le Guin

text: I must create a system, or be enslaved by another man's. I will not reason and compare: my business is to create
author: William Blake

text: If you love me, Henry, you don’t love me in a way I understand
author: Richard Siken

text: I would define, in brief, the poetry of words as the rhythmical creation of beauty
author: Edgar Allan Poe

text: A poet is, before anything else, a person who is passionately in love with language
author: W.H. Auden

text: I hunger for your sleek laugh and your hands the color of a furious harvest. I want to eat the sunbeams flaring in your beauty
author: Pablo Neruda

text: What can be explained is not poetry
author: W.B. Yeats

text: Beauty is truth, truth beauty,—that is all Ye know on earth, and all ye need to know
author: John Keats

text: The words ‘I Love You’ kill, and resurrect millions, in less than a second
author: Aberjhani

text: You are never too old to become younger!
author: Mae West

text: That night when you kissed me, I left a poem in your mouth, and you can hear some of the lines every time you breathe out
author: Andrea Gibson

text: You shall love your crooked neighbour, with your crooked heart
author: Wystan Hugh Auden

text: Poetry is the rhythmical creation of beauty in words
author: Edgar Allan Poe

text: It is always fatal to have music or poetry interrupted
author: George Eliot

text: Heard melodies are sweet, but those unheard Are sweeter; therefore, ye soft pipes, play on
author: John Keats

text: To elevate the soul, poetry is necessary
author: Edgar Allan Poe

text: We ran as if to meet the moon
author: Robert Frost

text: So dawn goes down today... Nothing gold can stay
author: Robert Frost

text: Sometimes I sit alone under the stars and think of the galaxies inside my heart and truly wonder if anyone will ever want to make sense of all that I am
author: Christopher Poindexter

text: Five minutes are enough to dream a whole life, that is how relative time is
author: Mario Benedetti

text: Whereas story is processed in the mind in a straightforward manner, poetry bypasses rational thought and goes straight to the limbic system and lights it up like a brushfire. It's the crack cocaine of the literary world
author: Jasper Fforde

text: I love you because no two snowflakes are alike, and it is possible, if you stand tippy-toe, to walk between the raindrops
author: Nikki Giovanni

text: We are made of all those who have built and broken us
author: Atticus Poetry

text: twice I have lived forever in a smile
author: E.E. Cummings

text: Go wisely and slowly. Those who rush stumble and fall
author: William Shakespeare

text: If you want me again look for me under your boot-soles
author: Walt Whitman

text: Out of the quarrel with others we make rhetoric; out of the quarrel with ourselves we make poetry
author: William Butler Yeats

text: The glory of Christianity is to conquer by forgiveness
author: William Blake

text: Oh phosphorescence. Now there’s a word to lift your hat to... To find that phosphorescence, that light within — is the genius behind poetry
author: William Luce

text: Poetry is a life-cherishing force. For poems are not words, after all, but fires for the cold, ropes let down to the lost, something as necessary as bread in the pockets of the hungry
author: Mary Oliver

text: One need not be a chamber to be haunted
author: Emily Dickinson

text: For darkness restores what light cannot repair
author: Joseph Brodsky

text: No’ might make them angry but it will make you free
author: Nayyirah Waheed

text: Poetry = Anger x Imagination
author: Sherman Alexie

text: I too am not a bit tamed, I too am untranslatable, I sound my barbaric yawp over the roofs of the world
author: Walt Whitman

text: There's an old saying that applies to me: you can't lose a game if you don't play the game
author: William Shakespeare

text: Listen, real poetry doesn't say anything; it just ticks off the possibilities. Opens all doors. You can walk through anyone that suits you
author: Jim Morrison

text: She conquered her demons and wore her scars like wings
author: Atticus Poetry

text: To hide feelings when you are near crying is the secret of dignity
author: Dejan Stojanovic

text: Poetry is not a turning loose of emotion, but an escape from emotion; it is not the expression of personality but an escape from personality. But, of course, only those who have personality and emotion know what it means to want to escape from these
author: T.S. Eliot

text: Every angel is terrifying
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

text: Truth can never be told so as to be understood and not be believed
author: William Blake

text: Every poem should remind the reader that they are going to die
author: Edgar Allen Poe

text: Maybe you could be mine / or maybe we’ll be entwined / aimless in this sexless foreplay
author: Jess C Scott

text: I live not in dreams but in contemplation of a reality that is perhaps the future
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

text: To fall in love with someone's thoughts - the most intimate, splendid romance
author: Sanober Khan

text: Here is the repeated image of the lover destroyed
author: Richard Siken

text: Poems are a hotline to our hearts, and we forget this emotional power at our peril
author: Andrew Motion

text: regret is mostly caused by not having done anything
author: Charles Bukowski

text: Don't Worry Be Happy
author: Meher Baba

text: Each star is a mirror reflecting the truth inside you
author: Aberjhani

text: My heart is lost; the beasts have eaten it
author: Charles Baudelaire

text: I am deliberate and afraid of nothing
author: Audre Lorde

text: I hope to arrive at my death, late, in love, and a little drunk
author: Atticus Poetry

text: I am the shore and the ocean, awaiting myself on both sides
author: Dejan Stojanovic

text: You had this expression on your face, like you weren’t quite sure you were supposed to be on Earth
author: Unknown

text: I often stood in front of the mirror alone, wondering how ugly a person could get
author: Charles Bukowski

text: By night, Love, tie your heart to mine, and the two together in their sleep will defeat the darkness
author: Pablo Neruda

text: Sometimes to self-discover you must self-destruct
author: Robert m drake

text: I dream of lost vocabularies that might express some of what we no longer can
author: Jack Gilbert

text: It is beautiful to express love and even more beautiful to feel it
author: Dejan Stojanovic

text: Whatever the imagination seizes as Beauty must be truth -whether it existed before or not
author: John Keats

text: It was her chaos that made her beautiful
author: Atticus Poetry

text: A poet is a man who manages, in a lifetime of standing out in thunderstorms, to be struck by lightning five or six times
author: Randall Jarell

text: Was not writing poetry a secret transaction, a voice answering a voice?
author: Virginia Woolf

text: Saints have no moderation, nor do poets, just exuberance
author: Anne Sexton

text: I am the poet of the poor, because I was poor when I loved; since I could not give gifts, I gave words
author: Ovid

text: Poetry: the best words in the best order
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
